title: undidR
text: undidR package implements difference--differences unpoolable data (UNDID); framework enables estimation average treatment effect treated (ATT) data different silos poolable. UNDID allows staggered common adoption inclusion covariates. addition, undidR also implements randomization inference (RI) procedure difference--differences described MacKinnon Webb (2020) calculate RI p-values. overview undidR framework: Schematic UNDID framework. following sections detail examples implementing undidR three stages staggered common adoption scenarios.

title: undidR
text: calling create_init_csv() silo names must specified along corresponding treatment times. Consequently, silos_names vector must length treatment_times vector. dates must entered date format. see valid date formats within undidR package call undid_date_formats(). Covariates may specified calling either create_init_csv() calling create_diff_df() via covariates parameter.

title: undidR
code: # First, an initializing CSV is created detailing the silos # and their treatment times. Control silos (here, 73 and 46) # should be labelled with "control". init <- create_init_csv(silo_names = c("73", "46", "71", "58"),                         start_times = "1989",                         end_times = "2000",                         treatment_times = c("control", "control",                                             "1991", "1991")) #> init.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpiiVlXU/init.csv init #>   silo_name start_time end_time treatment_time #> 1        73       1989     2000        control #> 2        46       1989     2000        control #> 3        71       1989     2000           1991 #> 4        58       1989     2000           1991  # After the initializing CSV file is created, `create_diff_df()` # can be called. This creates the empty differences data frame which # will then be filled out at each individual silo for its respective portion. init_filepath <- normalizePath(file.path(tempdir(), "init.csv"),                                winslash = "/", mustWork = FALSE) empty_diff_df <- create_diff_df(init_filepath, date_format = "yyyy",                                 freq = "yearly") #> empty_diff_df.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpiiVlXU/empty_diff_df.csv empty_diff_df #>   silo_name treat common_treatment_time start_time   end_time  weights #> 1        73     0                  1991 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 standard #> 2        46     0                  1991 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 standard #> 3        71     1                  1991 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 standard #> 4        58     1                  1991 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 standard #>   diff_estimate diff_var diff_estimate_covariates diff_var_covariates #> 1            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 2            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 3            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 4            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #>   covariates date_format   freq #> 1       none        yyyy 1 year #> 2       none        yyyy 1 year #> 3       none        yyyy 1 year #> 4       none        yyyy 1 year

title: undidR
code: # The initializing CSV for staggered adoption is created in the same way. # When `create_diff_df()` is run, it will automatically detect whether or not # the initial setup is for a common adoption or staggered adoption scenario. init <- create_init_csv(silo_names = c("73", "46", "54", "23", "86", "32",                                        "71", "58", "64", "59", "85", "57"),                         start_times = "1989",                         end_times = "2000",                         treatment_times = c(rep("control", 6),                                             "1991", "1993", "1996", "1997",                                             "1997", "1998")) #> init.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpiiVlXU/init.csv init #>    silo_name start_time end_time treatment_time #> 1         73       1989     2000        control #> 2         46       1989     2000        control #> 3         54       1989     2000        control #> 4         23       1989     2000        control #> 5         86       1989     2000        control #> 6         32       1989     2000        control #> 7         71       1989     2000           1991 #> 8         58       1989     2000           1993 #> 9         64       1989     2000           1996 #> 10        59       1989     2000           1997 #> 11        85       1989     2000           1997 #> 12        57       1989     2000           1998  # Creating the empty differences data frame and associated CSV file is # the same for the case of staggered adoption as it is for common adoption. init_filepath <- normalizePath(file.path(tempdir(), "init.csv"),                                winslash = "/", mustWork = FALSE) empty_diff_df <- create_diff_df(init_filepath, date_format = "yyyy",                                 freq = "yearly",                                 covariates = c("asian", "black", "male")) #> empty_diff_df.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpiiVlXU/empty_diff_df.csv head(empty_diff_df, 4) #>   silo_name gvar treat diff_times        gt RI start_time end_time #> 1        73 1991     0  1991;1990 1991;1991  0       1989     2000 #> 2        73 1991     0  1992;1990 1991;1992  0       1989     2000 #> 3        73 1991     0  1993;1990 1991;1993  0       1989     2000 #> 4        73 1991     0  1994;1990 1991;1994  0       1989     2000 #>   diff_estimate diff_var diff_estimate_covariates diff_var_covariates #> 1            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 2            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 3            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 4            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #>         covariates date_format   freq #> 1 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 2 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 3 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 4 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year

title: undidR
text: second stage function, undid_stage_two(), creates two CSV files. first filled portion differences data frame respective silo. second captures mean (mean residualized specified covariates) outcome variable start_time end_time intervals freq. returned undid_stage_two() list two data frames can accessed suffixes $diff_df $trends_data, respectively.

title: undidR
code: # When calling `undid_stage_two()`, ensure that the `time_column` of # the `silo_df` contains only character values, i.e. date strings. silo_data <- silo71 silo_data$year <- as.character(silo_data$year) empty_diff_filepath <- system.file("extdata/common", "empty_diff_df.csv",                                    package = "undidR") stage2 <- undid_stage_two(empty_diff_filepath, silo_name = "71",                           silo_df = silo_data, time_column = "year",                           outcome_column = "coll", silo_date_format = "yyyy") #> filled_diff_df_71.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpiiVlXU/filled_diff_df_71.csv #> trends_data_71.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpiiVlXU/trends_data_71.csv head(stage2$diff_df, 4) #>   silo_name treat common_treatment_time start_time   end_time           weights #> 1        71     1                  1991 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 0.829525483304042 #>   diff_estimate    diff_var diff_estimate_covariates diff_var_covariates #> 1    0.05879783 0.002597221                       NA                  NA #>   covariates date_format   freq #> 1       none        yyyy 1 year head(stage2$trends_data, 4) #>   silo_name treatment_time time mean_outcome mean_outcome_residualized #> 1        71           1991 1989    0.3061224                        NA #> 2        71           1991 1990    0.2708333                        NA #> 3        71           1991 1991    0.4000000                        NA #> 4        71           1991 1992    0.3400000                        NA #>   covariates date_format   freq #> 1       none        yyyy 1 year #> 2       none        yyyy 1 year #> 3       none        yyyy 1 year #> 4       none        yyyy 1 year

title: undidR
code: # Here we can see that calling `undid_stage_two()` for staggered adoption # is no different than calling `undid_stage_two()` for common adoption. silo_data <- silo71 silo_data$year <- as.character(silo_data$year) empty_diff_filepath <- system.file("extdata/staggered", "empty_diff_df.csv",                                     package = "undidR") stage2 <- undid_stage_two(empty_diff_filepath, silo_name = "71",                           silo_df = silo_data, time_column = "year",                           outcome_column = "coll", silo_date_format = "yyyy") #> filled_diff_df_71.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpiiVlXU/filled_diff_df_71.csv #> trends_data_71.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpiiVlXU/trends_data_71.csv head(stage2$diff_df, 4) #>   silo_name gvar treat diff_times        gt RI start_time   end_time #> 1        71 1991     1  1991;1990 1991;1991  0 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 #> 2        71 1991     1  1992;1990 1991;1992  0 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 #> 3        71 1991     1  1993;1990 1991;1993  0 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 #> 4        71 1991     1  1994;1990 1991;1994  0 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 #>   diff_estimate    diff_var diff_estimate_covariates diff_var_covariates #> 1    0.12916667 0.009447555              0.116348472         0.009397021 #> 2    0.06916667 0.008602222              0.069515594         0.008272557 #> 3    0.02546296 0.007975422              0.005133291         0.007767637 #> 4    0.02703901 0.008564103              0.029958108         0.008338060 #>         covariates date_format   freq #> 1 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 2 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 3 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 4 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year head(stage2$trends_data, 4) #>   silo_name treatment_time time mean_outcome mean_outcome_residualized #> 1        71           1991 1989    0.3061224                 0.1998800 #> 2        71           1991 1990    0.2708333                 0.1502040 #> 3        71           1991 1991    0.4000000                 0.1949109 #> 4        71           1991 1992    0.3400000                 0.1876636 #>         covariates date_format   freq #> 1 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 2 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 3 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 4 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year

title: undidR
text: third stage undidR produces aggregate ATT estimate, standard errors, p-values, well group level ATT estimates staggered adoption. case staggered adoption group level ATTs can either grouped silo (agg = "silo"), treatment time (agg = "g"), treatment time every time period treatment started (agg = "gt"). Plotting parallel trends figures conveniently fast tracked use plot_parallel_trends() function. important parameters highlighted examples , plethora options. Call ?plot_parallel_trends() see parameters descriptions.

title: undidR
code: # `undid_stage_three()`, given a `dir_path`, will search that folder # for all CSV files that begin with "filled_diff_df_" and stitch # them together in order to compute the group level ATTs, aggregate ATT # and associated standard errors and p-values. dir_path <- system.file("extdata/common", package = "undidR") results <- undid_stage_three(dir_path, covariates = FALSE) #> Warning in .stage_three_common(diff_df, weights, nperm): `nperm` was set to 1001 but the number of unique permutations is only 6  #> Overriding `nperm` to: 6 #> Warning in .stage_three_common(diff_df, weights, nperm): Randomization #> inference may not be valid with `nperm` < 500. results #>   treatment_time   agg_ATT agg_ATT_SE      pval agg_ATT_jknife_SE jknife_pval #> 1           7670 0.0213912 0.02509805 0.4838232         0.0434711   0.6713731 #>   RI_pval #> 1     0.4  # We can also view a parallel trends plot of our silos by callling # `plot_parallel_trends()`. This function will search a folder for all # CSV files that start with "trends_data" and combine them. The combined # data is returned by the function. trends <- plot_parallel_trends(   dir_path,   simplify_legend = FALSE, # Setting to `FALSE` puts every silo in legend   lwd = 3,                 # Set line width   ylim = c(0, 1),          # (min, max) of y-axis   xdates = as.Date(c("1989-01-01",                      "1991-01-01",                      "1993-01-01", # Explicity declare dates on x-axis                      "1995-01-01",                      "1997-01-01",                      "1999-01-01")),   date_format = "%Y", # Specify x-axis date format   ylabels = c(0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1), # Values on y-axis   legend_location = "topleft", # Where should the legend go?   legend_on = TRUE, # Defaults `TRUE`, can be set to `FALSE` to omit legend   ylab = "coll", # y-axis title   treatment_colour = c("red", # Set colours of treatment silos                        "coral"),   control_colour = c("#2fa7cf", # Colours can be entered as hexcodes                      "skyblue") ) head(trends, 4) #>   silo_name treatment_time       time mean_outcome mean_outcome_residualized #> 1        46        control 1989-01-01    0.5245902                        NA #> 2        46        control 1990-01-01    0.4545455                        NA #> 3        46        control 1991-01-01    0.5490196                        NA #> 4        46        control 1992-01-01    0.6250000                        NA #>   covariates date_format   freq         y #> 1       none        yyyy 1 year 0.5245902 #> 2       none        yyyy 1 year 0.4545455 #> 3       none        yyyy 1 year 0.5490196 #> 4       none        yyyy 1 year 0.6250000

title: undidR
code: # When calling `undid_stage_three()` for staggered adoption it is # important to specify the aggregation method, `agg`. dir_path <- system.file("extdata/staggered", package = "undidR") results <- undid_stage_three(dir_path, agg = "silo", covariates = TRUE,                              nperm = 501) #> Completed 100 of 500 permutations #> Completed 200 of 500 permutations #> Completed 300 of 500 permutations #> Completed 400 of 500 permutations #> Completed 500 of 500 permutations  # The `nperm` parameter specifies how many permutations # to consider for randomization inference.  results #>   silo_name    silo_ATT    silo_SE  silo_p_val silo_jknife_SE silo_jknife_p_val #> 1        57 -0.08144843 0.06215099 0.205650586     0.08649845       0.358207857 #> 2        58  0.05280529 0.02538483 0.042267963     0.02689507       0.054760168 #> 3        59  0.12365658 0.03562132 0.001823809     0.04254611       0.007377655 #> 4        64  0.07263498 0.03311326 0.035420278     0.03786681       0.063776333 #> 5        71  0.04618515 0.02595757 0.079666710     0.02796956       0.103295735 #> 6        85  0.07400401 0.03456541 0.041820821     0.04102590       0.082856564 #>      agg_ATT agg_ATT_SE agg_ATT_p_val agg_ATT_jknife_SE agg_ATT_jknife_p_val #> 1 0.04797293 0.02570683     0.1210099        0.02816042            0.1636711 #> 2         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #> 3         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #> 4         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #> 5         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #> 6         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #>   agg_ATT_RI_p_val #> 1            0.152 #> 2               NA #> 3               NA #> 4               NA #> 5               NA #> 6               NA  # If we have many silos, but want to view a parallel trends plot # we can set `combine = TRUE` when calling `plot_parallel_trends()` # which will combine all treatment silos into a single line, and all # control silos into a single line. trends <- plot_parallel_trends(   dir_path,   combine = TRUE, # Plots one line for control and one line for treated   simplify_legend = TRUE, # Reduces legend to simply "Control" and "Treated"   lwd = 3,                 # Set line width   ylim = c(0.2, 0.6),          # (min, max) of y-axis   xdates = as.Date(c("1989-01-01",                      "1991-01-01",                      "1993-01-01", # Explicity declare dates on x-axis                      "1995-01-01",                      "1997-01-01",                      "1999-01-01")),   date_format = "%Y", # Specify x-axis date format   ylabels = c(0.2, 0.4, 0.6), # Values on y-axis   legend_location = "topright", # Where should the legend go?   treatment_indicator_lwd = 2, # line width for the treatment indicator lines   treatment_indicator_alpha = 0.2, # transparency for treatment indicator lines   treatment_indicator_col = "red" # colour for treatment indicator lines ) head(trends, 4) #>         time silo_name         y treatment_time date_format #> 1 1989-01-01 Treatment 0.3367429           <NA>        yyyy #> 2 1989-01-01   Control 0.4322536           <NA>        yyyy #> 3 1990-01-01 Treatment 0.3521812           <NA>        yyyy #> 4 1990-01-01   Control 0.4222644           <NA>        yyyy

title: undidR
text: Karim, S., Webb, M., Austin, N., Strumpf, E. 2024. Difference--Differences Unpoolable Data. https://arxiv.org/abs/2403.15910 MacKinnon, J. Webb, M. 2020. Randomization inference difference--differences treated clusters. Journal Econometrics. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jeconom.2020.04.024

code: @Manual{,   title = {undidR: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data},   author = {Eric Jamieson},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.1, https://ebjamieson97.github.io/undidR/},   url = {https://github.com/ebjamieson97/undidR}, }

title: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data
text: undidR package provides framework implementing difference--differences unpoolable data (UNDID) developed Karim, Webb, Austin, Strumpf (2024). UNDID designed estimate average treatment effect treated (ATT) settings data different silos pooled together (potentially reasons confidentiality). package supports common staggered adoption scenarios, well optional inclusion covariates. Additionally, undidR incorporates randomization inference (RI) procedure, based MacKinnon Webb (2020), calculating p-values UNDID ATT. See image overview undidR framework:

title: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data
text: can install stable release version undidR CRAN :
code: install.packages("undidR")

title: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data
text: set highly detailed examples see package vignette using: following code chunks show basic examples using undidR three stages.
code: vignette("undidR", package = "undidR")

title: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data
code: library(undidR) init <- create_init_csv(silo_names = c("73", "46", "54", "23", "86", "32",                                        "71", "58", "64", "59", "85", "57"),                         start_times = "1989",                         end_times = "2000",                         treatment_times = c(rep("control", 6),                                             "1991", "1993", "1996", "1997",                                             "1997", "1998")) #> init.csv saved to: C:/Users/Eric Bruce Jamieson/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpOSra8e/init.csv init #>    silo_name start_time end_time treatment_time #> 1         73       1989     2000        control #> 2         46       1989     2000        control #> 3         54       1989     2000        control #> 4         23       1989     2000        control #> 5         86       1989     2000        control #> 6         32       1989     2000        control #> 7         71       1989     2000           1991 #> 8         58       1989     2000           1993 #> 9         64       1989     2000           1996 #> 10        59       1989     2000           1997 #> 11        85       1989     2000           1997 #> 12        57       1989     2000           1998  init_filepath <- normalizePath(file.path(tempdir(), "init.csv"),                                winslash = "/", mustWork = FALSE) empty_diff_df <- create_diff_df(init_filepath, date_format = "yyyy",                                 freq = "yearly",                                 covariates = c("asian", "black", "male")) #> empty_diff_df.csv saved to: C:/Users/Eric Bruce Jamieson/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpOSra8e/empty_diff_df.csv head(empty_diff_df, 4) #>   silo_name gvar treat diff_times        gt RI start_time end_time #> 1        73 1991 73 1991     0  1994;1990 1991;1994  0       1989     2000 #>   diff_estimate diff_var diff_estimate_covariates diff_var_covariates #> 1            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 2            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 3            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #> 4            NA       NA                       NA                  NA #>         covariates date_format   freq #> 1 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 2 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 3 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 4 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year

title: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data
code: dir_path <- system.file("extdata/staggered", package = "undidR") results <- undid_stage_three(dir_path, agg = "silo", covariates = TRUE,                              nperm = 501) #> Completed 100 of 500 permutations #> Completed 200 of 500 permutations #> Completed 300 of 500 permutations #> Completed 400 of 500 permutations #> Completed 500 of 500 permutations results #>   silo_name    silo_ATT    silo_SE  silo_p_val silo_jknife_SE silo_jknife_p_val #> 1        57 -0.08144843 0.06215099 0.205650586     0.08649845       0.358207857 #> 2        58  0.05280529 0.02538483 0.042267963     0.02689507       0.054760168 #> 3        59  0.12365658 0.03562132 0.001823809     0.04254611       0.007377655 #> 4        64  0.07263498 0.03311326 0.035420278     0.03786681       0.063776333 #> 5        71  0.04618515 0.02595757 0.079666710     0.02796956       0.103295735 #> 6        85  0.07400401 0.03456541 0.041820821     0.04102590       0.082856564 #>      agg_ATT agg_ATT_SE agg_ATT_p_val agg_ATT_jknife_SE agg_ATT_jknife_p_val #> 1 0.04797293 0.02570683     0.1210099        0.02816042            0.1636711 #> 2         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #> 3         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #> 4         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #> 5         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #> 6         NA         NA            NA                NA                   NA #>   agg_ATT_RI_p_val #> 1             0.18 #> 2               NA #> 3               NA #> 4               NA #> 5               NA #> 6               NA

title: Creates the empty_diff_df.csv — create_diff_df
text: Creates empty_diff_df.csv lists differences need calculated silo order compute aggregate ATT. empty_diff_df.csv sent silo filled .

title: Creates the empty_diff_df.csv — create_diff_df
code: create_diff_df(   init_filepath,   date_format,   freq,   covariates = FALSE,   freq_multiplier = FALSE,   weights = "standard",   filename = "empty_diff_df.csv",   filepath = tempdir() )

title: Creates the empty_diff_df.csv — create_diff_df
text: init_filepath character filepath init.csv. date_format character specifying date format used init.csv. Call undid_date_formats() see list valid date formats. freq character indicating length time periods used computing differences mean outcomes periods silo. Options : "yearly", "monthly", "weekly", "daily". covariates character vector specifying covariates considered silo. FALSE (default) uses covariates init.csv. freq_multiplier numeric value FALSE (default). Specify frequency multiplied non-zero integer. weights character indicating weighting use case common adoption. "standard" (default) weight calculated \(w_s = \frac{N_s^{\text{post}}}{N_s^{\text{post}} + N_s^{\text{pre}}}\). Options : "standard". filename character filename created CSV file. Defaults "empty_diff_df.csv" filepath Filepath save CSV file. Defaults tempdir().

title: Creates the empty_diff_df.csv — create_diff_df
text: data frame detailing silo time combinations differences must calculated order compute aggregate ATT. CSV copy saved specified directory sent silo.

title: Creates the empty_diff_df.csv — create_diff_df
text: Ensure dates init.csv entered consistently date format. Call undid_date_formats() see list valid date formats. Covariates specified calling create_diff_df() override covariates specified init.csv.

title: Creates the init.csv — create_init_csv
text: create_init_csv() function generates CSV file information silo's start times, end times, treatment times. parameters left empty, generates blank CSV headers.

title: Creates the init.csv — create_init_csv
code: create_init_csv(   silo_names = character(),   start_times = character(),   end_times = character(),   treatment_times = character(),   covariates = character(),   filename = "init.csv",   filepath = tempdir() )

title: Creates the init.csv — create_init_csv
text: silo_names character vector silo names. start_times character vector start times. end_times character vector end times. treatment_times character vector treatment times. covariates character vector covariates, , FALSE (default). filename character filename created initializing CSV file. Defaults "init.csv". filepath Filepath save CSV file. Defaults tempdir().

title: Creates the init.csv — create_init_csv
text: data frame containing contents written CSV file. CSV file saved specified directory (temporary directory default) default filename init.csv.

title: Creates the init.csv — create_init_csv
text: Ensure dates entered consistently date format. Call undid_date_formats() view valid date formats. Control silos marked "control" treatment_times vector. covariates FALSE, covariate column included CSV.

title: Creates the init.csv — create_init_csv
code: create_init_csv(   silo_names = c("73", "46", "54", "23", "86", "32",                  "71", "58", "64", "59", "85", "57"),   start_times = "1989",   end_times = "2000",   treatment_times = c(rep("control", 6),                       "1991", "1993", "1996", "1997", "1997", "1998"),   covariates = c("asian", "black", "male") ) #> init.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpuNv0QI/init.csv #>    silo_name start_time end_time treatment_time       covariates #> 1         73       1989     2000        control asian;black;male #> 2         46       1989     2000        control asian;black;male #> 3         54       1989     2000        control asian;black;male #> 4         23       1989     2000        control asian;black;male #> 5         86       1989     2000        control asian;black;male #> 6         32       1989     2000        control asian;black;male #> 7         71       1989     2000           1991 asian;black;male #> 8         58       1989     2000           1993 asian;black;male #> 9         64       1989     2000           1996 asian;black;male #> 10        59       1989     2000           1997 asian;black;male #> 11        85       1989     2000           1997 asian;black;male #> 12        57       1989     2000           1998 asian;black;male unlink(file.path(tempdir(), "init.csv"))

title: Plots parallel trends figures — plot_parallel_trends
text: plot_parallel_trends() function combines various trends data CSV files plots parallel trends figures. treatment control groups can combined one control line one treatment line setting combine = TRUE.

title: Plots parallel trends figures — plot_parallel_trends
code: plot_parallel_trends(   dir_path,   covariates = FALSE,   save_csv = FALSE,   combine = FALSE,   pch = NA,   pch_control = NA,   pch_treated = NA,   control_colour = c("darkgrey", "lightgrey"),   control_color = NULL,   treatment_colour = c("darkred", "lightcoral"),   treatment_color = NULL,   lwd = 2,   xlab = NA,   ylab = NA,   title = NA,   xticks = 4,   date_format = "%Y-%m-%d",   xdates = NULL,   xaxlabsz = 0.8,   save_png = FALSE,   width = 800,   height = 600,   ylim = NULL,   yaxlabsz = 0.8,   ylabels = NULL,   yticks = 4,   ydecimal = 2,   legend_location = "topright",   simplify_legend = TRUE,   legend_cex = 0.7,   legend_on = TRUE,   treatment_indicator_col = "grey",   treatment_indicator_alpha = 0.5,   treatment_indicator_lwd = 2,   treatment_indicator_lty = 2,   interpolate = FALSE,   filepath = tempdir(),   filenamecsv = "combined_trends_data.csv",   filenamepng = "undid_plot.png" )

title: Plots parallel trends figures — plot_parallel_trends
text: dir_path character filepath folder containing trends data CSV files. covariates logical value (defaults FALSE) indicating whether consider covariates, .e. whether use mean_outcome column mean_outcome_residualized column trends data CSV files. save_csv logical value (defaults FALSE) indicating whether save combined_trends_data.csv. combine logical value (defaults FALSE) indicating whether plot silo separately combine silos based treatment status. pch integer (0 25) vector integers (0 25) determine style points used plot. Setting NA (default) omit points plot. pch_control integer (0 25) vector integers (0 25) determine style points used plot control silos. Takes value pch set NULL (default). pch_treated integer (0 25) vector integers (0 25) determine style points used plot treated silos. Takes value pch set NULL (default). control_colour character vector colours (defaults c("darkgrey", "lightgrey")) control silo lines. combine = TRUE, takes 1st value determine colour control line. control_color Overrides control_colour used. Defaults NULL. treatment_colour character vector colours (defaults c("darkred", "lightcoral")) treatment silos. combine = TRUE, takes 1st value determine colour control line. treatment_color Overrides control_colour used. Defaults NULL. lwd integer (defaults 2) selecting line widths. xlab character value x-axis label (defaults NA). ylab character value y-axis label (defaults NA). title character value title plot (defaults NA). xticks integer value denoting many ticks display x-axis (defaults 4). date_format string value denoting format display dates along x-axis (defaults "%Y"). Uses standard R date formatting styles. xdates Takes vector date objects used dates shown along x-axis (defaults NULL). xaxlabsz double indicating x-axis label sizes comparison standardized default size (defaults 0.8). save_png logical value indicating whether save plot PNG file (defaults FALSE). width integer denoting width saved PNG file. height integer denoting height saved PNG file. ylim vector two doubles defining min max range values y-axis. Defaults min max values values plotted. yaxlabsz double specifying y-axis label sizes (defaults 0.8) comparison standardized default size. ylabels vector values like appear y-axis (defaults NULL). yticks integer denoting many values display along y-axis (defaults 4). ydecimal integer value denoting decimal point values along y-axis rounded . legend_location character value determining location legend (defaults "topright"). Options : "topright", "topleft", "bottomright", "bottomleft", "top", "bottom", "left", "right", "center". simplify_legend logical value set TRUE shows one colour treatment silos legend one colour control silos. Defaults TRUE. legend_cex double adjusting size text legend compared standard default size. Defaults 0.7. legend_on logical value turning legend (defaults TRUE). treatment_indicator_col character value determining colour dashed vertical lines showing treatment times (defaults "grey"). treatment_indicator_alpha double determining transparency level dashed vertical lines showing treatment times (defaults 0.5). treatment_indicator_lwd double selecting line width treatment indicator lines (defaults 2). treatment_indicator_lty integer selecting lty option, .e. line style, treatment_indicator lines (defaults 2). interpolate logical value (either TRUE FALSE) determines interpolation used fill missing trends data. Defaults FALSE. Uses piecewise linear function. filepath Filepath save CSV file. Defaults tempdir(). filenamecsv string filename combined trends data Defaults "combined_trends_data.csv". filenamepng string filename PNG file output. Defaults "undid_plot.png".

title: Plots parallel trends figures — plot_parallel_trends
text: data frame built trends data CSV files specified directory. combine = FALSE, data frame includes silos joined row. combine = TRUE, data frame merges treated silos single treatment group control silos single control group.

title: Example merit data — silo71
text: dataset containing college enrollment demographic data analyzing effects merit programs state 71.

title: Example merit data — silo71
code: silo71

title: Example merit data — silo71
text: tibble 569 rows 7 variables: coll Binary indicator college enrollment (outcome variable) merit Binary indicator merit program (treatment variable) male Binary indicator male students black Binary indicator Black students asian Binary indicator Asian students year Year observation state State identifier

title: Example merit data — silo71
text: https://economics.uwo.ca/people/conley_docs/code_to_download.html

what: undidR: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data — undidR-package
title: undidR: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data — undidR-package
text: framework estimating difference--differences unpoolable data, based Karim, Webb, Austin, Strumpf (2024) doi:10.48550/arXiv.2403.15910 . Supports common staggered adoption, multiple groups, inclusion covariates. Also computes p-values aggregate average treatment effect treated via randomization inference procedure described MacKinnon Webb (2020) doi:10.1016/j.jeconom.2020.04.024 .

title: undidR: Difference-in-Differences with Unpoolable Data — undidR-package
text: Maintainer: Eric Jamieson ericbrucejamieson@gmail.com [copyright holder]

title: Shows valid date formats — undid_date_formats
text: undid_date_formats() function returns list valid date formats can used within undidR package.

title: Shows valid date formats — undid_date_formats
code: undid_date_formats()

title: Shows valid date formats — undid_date_formats
text: named list containing valid date formats: General_Formats: General date formats compatible package. R_Specific_Formats: Date formats specific R. Other_Formats: Formats seen sometimes Stata.

title: Shows valid date formats — undid_date_formats
text: date formats returned function used ensure consistency date processing within undidR package.

title: Shows valid date formats — undid_date_formats
code: undid_date_formats() #> $General_Formats #>  [1] "yyyy/mm/dd" "yyyy-mm-dd" "yyyymmdd"   "yyyy/dd/mm" "yyyy-dd-mm" #>  [6] "yyyyddmm"   "dd/mm/yyyy" "dd-mm-yyyy" "ddmmyyyy"   "mm/dd/yyyy" #> [11] "mm-dd-yyyy" "mmddyyyy"   "yyyy"       #>  #> $R_Specific_Formats #>  [1] "%Y/%m/%d" "%Y-%m-%d" "%Y%m%d"   "%Y/%d/%m" "%Y-%d-%m" "%Y%d%m"   #>  [7] "%d/%m/%Y" "%d-%m-%Y" "%d%m%Y"   "%m/%d/%Y" "%m-%d-%Y" "%m%d%Y"   #> [13] "%Y"       #>  #> $Other_Formats #> [1] "ddmonyyyy" "yyyym00"   #>

title: Computes UNDID results — undid_stage_three
text: Takes filled diff df CSV files uses compute group level ATTs well aggregate ATT standard errors p-values.

title: Computes UNDID results — undid_stage_three
code: undid_stage_three(   dir_path,   agg = "silo",   weights = TRUE,   covariates = FALSE,   interpolation = FALSE,   save_csv = FALSE,   filename = "UNDID_results.csv",   filepath = tempdir(),   nperm = 1001,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Computes UNDID results — undid_stage_three
text: dir_path character specifying filepath folder containing filled diff df CSV files. agg character specifies aggregation methodology computing aggregate ATT case staggered adoption. Options : "silo", "g", "gt". Defaults "silo". weights logical value (either TRUE FALSE) determines whether weights used case common adoption. Defaults TRUE. covariates logical value (either TRUE FALSE) specifies whether use diff_estimate column diff_estimate_covariates column filled diff df CSV files computing ATTs. interpolation logical value character specifies , , method interpolation/extrapolation missing values diff_estimate diff_estimate_covariates used. must least one diff_estimate diff_estimate_covariates value (silo,g) group missing value estimated order interpolation work. Options : "linear_function", "nearest_value", "piecewise_linear". Defaults FALSE. save_csv logical value, either TRUE FALSE (default), determines CSV copy UNDID results saved . filename string filename created CSV file. Defaults "UNDID_results.csv" filepath Filepath save CSV file. Defaults tempdir(). nperm Number random permutations gvar & silo pairs consider calculating randomization inference p-value. Defaults 1001. verbose logical value (either TRUE FALSE) toggles messages showing progress randomization inference. Defaults TRUE.

title: Computes UNDID results — undid_stage_three
text: data frame containing aggregate ATT standard errors p-values two-sided tests agg_ATT == 0. Also returns group (silo, g, gt) level ATTs staggered adoption.

title: Computes UNDID results — undid_stage_three
text: agg parameter specifies aggregation method used case staggered adoption. default set "silo" ATTs aggregated across silos silo equal weight, can set "gt" "g" instead. Aggregating across "g" calculates ATTs groups based treatment time , "g" group equal weight. Aggregating across "gt" calculates ATTs groups based treatment time time ATT calculated. agg parameter ignored case common treatment time takes effect case staggered adoption. common adoption, refer weights parameter.

what: Runs UNDID stage two procedures — undid_stage_two
title: Runs UNDID stage two procedures — undid_stage_two
text: Based information given received empty_diff_df.csv, computes appropriate differences mean outcomes local silo saves filled_diff_df_$silo_name.csv. Also stores trends data trends_data_$silo_name.csv.

title: Runs UNDID stage two procedures — undid_stage_two
code: undid_stage_two(   empty_diff_filepath,   silo_name,   silo_df,   time_column,   outcome_column,   silo_date_format,   consider_covariates = TRUE,   filepath = tempdir() )

title: Runs UNDID stage two procedures — undid_stage_two
text: empty_diff_filepath character filepath empty_diff_df.csv. silo_name character indicating name local silo. Ensure spelling written empty_diff_df.csv. silo_df data frame local silo's data. Ensure covariates spelled data frame empty_diff_df.csv. time_column character indicates name column silo_df contains date data. Ensure time_column references column character values. outcome_column character indicates name column silo_df contains outcome interest. Ensure outcome_column references column numeric values. silo_date_format character indicates date format date strings time_column written . consider_covariates optional logical parameter set FALSE ignores computations involving covariates. Defaults TRUE. filepath Character value indicating filepath save CSV files. Defaults tempdir().

title: Runs UNDID stage two procedures — undid_stage_two
text: list data frames. first filled differences data frame, second trends data data frame. Use suffix $diff_df access filled differences data frame, use $trends_data access trends data data frame.

title: Runs UNDID stage two procedures — undid_stage_two
text: Covariates local silo renamed match spelling used empty_diff_df.csv.

title: Runs UNDID stage two procedures — undid_stage_two
code: # Load data silo_data <- silo71 empty_diff_path <- system.file("extdata/staggered", "empty_diff_df.csv",                                package = "undidR")  # Run `undid_stage_two()` results <- undid_stage_two(   empty_diff_filepath = empty_diff_path,   silo_name = "71",   silo_df = silo_data,   time_column = "year",   outcome_column = "coll",   silo_date_format = "yyyy" ) #> filled_diff_df_71.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpuNv0QI/filled_diff_df_71.csv #> trends_data_71.csv saved to: /tmp/RtmpuNv0QI/trends_data_71.csv  # View results head(results$diff_df) #>   silo_name gvar treat diff_times        gt RI start_time   end_time #> 1        71 1991     1  1991;1990 1991;1991  0 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 #> 2        71 1991     1  1992;1990 1991;1992  0 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 #> 3 2000-01-01 #> 6        71 1991     1  1996;1990 1991;1996  0 1989-01-01 2000-01-01 #>   diff_estimate    diff_var diff_estimate_covariates diff_var_covariates #> 1    0.12916667 0.009447555 0.02703901 0.008564103              0.029958108         0.008338060 #> 5    0.17361111 0.008686695              0.168621303         0.007994236 #> 6    0.13594633 0.008204221              0.146360101         0.007834932 #>         covariates date_format   freq #> 1 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 2 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 3 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 4 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 5 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 6 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year head(results$trends_data) #>   silo_name treatment_time time mean_outcome mean_outcome_residualized #> 1        71           1991 1989    0.3061224                 0.1998800 #> 2        71           1991 1990    0.2708333                 0.1502040 #> 3        71           1991 1991    0.4000000                 0.1949109 #> 4        71           1991 1992    0.3400000                 0.1876636 #> 5        71           1991 1993    0.2962963                 0.1750943 #> 6        71           1991 1994    0.2978723                 0.1195425 #>         covariates date_format   freq #> 1 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 2 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 3 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 4 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 5 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year #> 6 asian;black;male        yyyy 1 year  # Clean up temporary files unlink(file.path(tempdir(), c("diff_df_71.csv",                              "trends_data_71.csv")))

text: Fixed miscalculation standard weights stage two common adoption scenarios.
